com.percussion.util
Class PSDateFormatISO8601

java.lang.Object
  java.text.Format
      com.percussion.util.PSDateFormatISO8601
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable
public class PSDateFormatISO8601
extends Format

The PSDateFormatISO8601 formats dates in ISO 8601 format. (yyyyMMdd'T'HHmmssSSS). For instance, 19981231T00000000 represents midnight, December 31, 1998. mm are milliseconds, and they can be left out if desired. Note that this class does not extend DateFormat, because the ISO 8601 format is much less flexible than a generic (or even simple) date format.

See Also:
Serialized Form

format

public final String format(Date date)
                    throws IllegalArgumentException
Formats the provided date into ISO 8601 and returns its string representation.

Parameters:
date - the date to be formated, not null.
Returns:
a new String representing the given date in ISO 8601 format.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the provided date is null.

format

public final StringBuffer format(Object ob,
                                 StringBuffer appendTo,
                                 FieldPosition pos)
                          throws IllegalArgumentException
Formats a time object into an ISO 8601 time string.

Specified by:
format in class Format
Parameters:
ob - the date object to be formatted, must be of type Date, not null.
appendTo - the string buffer for the returning time string.
pos - the field position. On input, the position at which to start parsing; on output, the position at which parsing terminated, or the start position if the parse failed. set to the beginning and end of its field parameter, which must be one of:
  • DateFormat.YEAR_FIELD
  • DateFormat.MONTH_FIELD
  • DateFormat.DATE_FIELD
  • DateFormat.HOUR_OF_DAY0_FIELD
  • DateFormat.MINUTE_FIELD
  • DateFormat.SECOND_FIELD
  • DateFormat.MILLISECOND_FIELD
Returns:
the formatted ISO 8601 time string, appended at the position given.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is null.

parse

public Date parse(String source,
                  ParsePosition pos)
Parses the provided string for an ISO 8601 formatted date.

Parameters:
source - The string containing an ISO 8601 date representation
pos - On input, the position at which to start parsing; on output, the position at which parsing terminated, or the start position if the parse failed.
Returns:
A new java.util.Date object built from the specified string, which contains an ISO 8601 format starting at position pos. Returns null if the format was invalid.

parseObject

public Object parseObject(String source,
                          ParsePosition pos)
A convenience method. Simply calls parse(String, ParsePosition). See parseObject(String, ParsePosition) for description.

Specified by:
parseObject in class Format
